intro: Eriostemon alpinus, commonly known as the alpine eriostemon, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to withstand cold and windy conditions. Eriostemon alpinus is often found in mountainous regions and is a notable component of New Zealand’s alpine flora.
